Package org.neo4j.kernel.impl.transaction.log.checkpoint

Interface CheckPointer

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CheckPointerImpl
    public interface CheckPointer
    This interface represent a check pointer which is responsible to write check points in the transaction log.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      long checkPointIfNeeded​(TriggerInfo triggerInfo)
      This method will verify that the conditions for triggering a check point hold and in such a case it will write a check point in the transaction log.
      long forceCheckPoint​(TriggerInfo triggerInfo)
      This method forces the write of a check point in the transaction log.
      long lastCheckPointedTransactionId()  
      long tryCheckPoint​(TriggerInfo triggerInfo)
      This method tries the write of a check point in the transaction log.
      long tryCheckPoint​(TriggerInfo triggerInfo, BooleanSupplier timeout)
      This method tries the write of a check point in the transaction log.
      long tryCheckPointNoWait​(TriggerInfo triggerInfo)
      This method tries the write of a check point in the transaction log.

    • Method Detail

      • checkPointIfNeeded

        long checkPointIfNeeded​(TriggerInfo triggerInfo)
                 throws IOException
        This method will verify that the conditions for triggering a check point hold and in such a case it will write a check point in the transaction log. This method does NOT handle concurrency since there should be only one check point thread running.
        Parameters:
        triggerInfo - the info describing why check pointing has been triggered pending approval of the threshold check
        Returns:
        the transaction id used for the check pointing or -1 if check pointing wasn't needed
        Throws:
        IOException - if writing the check point fails

      • tryCheckPoint

        long tryCheckPoint​(TriggerInfo triggerInfo)
            throws IOException
        This method tries the write of a check point in the transaction log. If there is no running check pointing it will check point otherwise it will wait for the running check pointing to complete.
        Parameters:
        triggerInfo - the info describing why check pointing has been triggered
        Returns:
        the transaction id used for the check pointing.
        Throws:
        IOException - if writing the check point fails

      • tryCheckPoint

        long tryCheckPoint​(TriggerInfo triggerInfo,
                   BooleanSupplier timeout)
            throws IOException
        This method tries the write of a check point in the transaction log. If there is no running check pointing it will check point otherwise it will wait for the running check pointing to complete. It is mostly used for testing purpose and to force a check point when shutting down the database.
        Parameters:
        triggerInfo - the info describing why check pointing has been triggered
        timeout - a boolean supplier that, if it returns true, will signal that we should stop waiting for any on-going checkpoint to complete.
        Returns:
        the transaction id used for the check pointing, or -1 if we ended up waiting for an on-going checkpoint and the timeout returned false telling us to give up waiting.
        Throws:
        IOException - if writing the check point fails

      • tryCheckPointNoWait

        long tryCheckPointNoWait​(TriggerInfo triggerInfo)
                  throws IOException
        This method tries the write of a check point in the transaction log. If there is no running check pointing it will check point otherwise it will return -1.
        Parameters:
        triggerInfo - the info describing why check pointing has been triggered
        Returns:
        the transaction id used for the check pointing or -1 when the invocation did not trigger a check point.
        Throws:
        IOException - if writing the check point fails

      • forceCheckPoint

        long forceCheckPoint​(TriggerInfo triggerInfo)
              throws IOException
        This method forces the write of a check point in the transaction log. It is mostly used for testing purpose and to force a check point when shutting down the database.
        Parameters:
        triggerInfo - the info describing why check pointing has been triggered
        Returns:
        the transaction id used for the check pointing
        Throws:
        IOException - if writing the check point fails

      • lastCheckPointedTransactionId

        long lastCheckPointedTransactionId()
        Returns:
        the transaction id which the last checkpoint was made it. If there's no checkpoint then TransactionIdStore.BASE_TX_ID is returned.
